Based on your preferences, I would recommend "A Tale of Two Cities" and "Under the Dome". Both movies are about Chinese culture and society. "A Tale of Two Cities" is a classic novel by Charles Dickens, set in London during the French Revolution. "Under the Dome" is a TV series that was originally broadcast on CCTV-1 in 2015. The TV series is based on a novel called "The Under-Dome Project: A Study on the Realities of China's Industrialization", written by Guo Xiaoyu, which was first published in 2014.
Both movies are worth watching and have gained popularity among Chinese audiences.

Based on your preferences, I would recommend watching "The Wind That Shakes the Barley" (2006) directed by Sean Penn. This film is a dramatization of the July 20, 1944 assassination and political coup plot by desperate renegade German Army officers against Adolf Hitler during World War II. The movie stars Marlon Brando as Benito Mussolini, James Whitmore as Franklin D. Roosevelt, Richard Anderson as Harry S. Truman, Joseph Cotten as Pope Pius XII, Martin Balsam as General Douglas MacArthur.
